ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend all people to take an ethics course, but it would have been nicer to get more serious facts on ethical conundrums.
I would tell any INP student that is a fun and easily filled requirement.
Yes, I will recommend this class to another student.
It is required course that can be used to ask questions about how and why scientists do what they do.
Well, this is a obligatory class, so there is not much point of recommendation.My summary would be "have fun, you will be fine."

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It got me thinking about ethical issues but wasn't rigorous enough to get a firm grasp on exactly what an ethical scientist in current society is.
This course gave me a context to think about many issues relating to doing science in a lab environment and a wide range of other topics that I think will be generally helpful in the years to come.

Yes, it did deepen my knowledge of my discipline.To be a good scientist is not just about doing good research. To be a 'ethically' qualified person is essentially important as well.This class gave us a general ethical guidance in science. It will be very helpful for our future career in scientific research.
My scope of the field broadened and I learned important information regarding the current state of neuroscience ethics.

I get the impression from the course that everything is heavily regulated in CT. This is both good and bad for me so I have a mixed feeling towards it. I would love to keep my research under proper regulation and I do not want to cause any trouble. So this is a very helpful class on that perspective.
